llm.feedback: 1. Change the first line’s sign from “Up” to “Down” (or label it “Flat” but must use Up/Down) because the alt‑1 scenario predicts DXY ≈ 0 % (5)(4); add a 30 % probability and cite (5)(4). 2. Add inline citations to every claim: base‑case DXY ↓ 1‑2 % (4)(5)(2)(1), alt‑1 flat (5)(4), alt‑2 ↓ 0‑1 % (2), Fed cut ↑ DXY 50‑100 bp (5)(Z7O1DCHS7). 3. Tighten driver phrasing to a single catalyst phrase, e.g., “Fed remains independent & tariffs rolled back” or “Trump tariff order + Fed threat + China‑Russia trade surge.” 4. Align watch points directly with the catalysts: Fed minutes & tariff enforcement pace; EU cloud spending, Fed minutes, China‑Russia oil volumes; China‑Russia oil volumes & CNY‑USD; Fed minutes & CPI 2025‑08‑15. 5. Re‑balance probabilities to reflect likelihood: base‑case 70 % DXY ↓ 1‑2 %; alt‑1 30 % flat; alt‑2 10 % DXY ↓ 0‑1 %; Fed cut 10 % DXY ↑. 6. Keep each line a single, concise sentence, no filler, and ensure each maps to the canonical DXY handle.
